result.execSummary:
The defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Conference held October 7, 2014
from DOC concerning length of probation
from State Public Defender - Appellate Division regarding appeal.

04:12 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Drengler also appears on behalf of defendant for case 14cf86.  Calling 14cf61 and 14cf86.  State moves to amend Count 1 in 14cf61 to 961.41(3g)(b) - Granted.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Drengler/Finlan/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence 14cf61 and 14cf86 Cts 3 and 4
WHS/POP 3 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge (1 ct only)/Supervision Fees
No contact with Mr. Johnson
Engage in mental health treatment
Jail - 60 days  in 14cf86 only CC - W/Huber for all purposes 
Jail credit 4 days in case 14cf61
Jail credit 141 days in case 14cf86
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Intra-Circuit Transfer
State's Reply to Discovery continued

Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Detective Sara Garnder/sworn/direct.  Record reflects identification of defendant.  States Exhibit #1 marked/copy of transaction report from Wal Mart/received/cross.  State rests.  Atty Finlan statement to court-objects exhibit #1 being received and states reasons/Michlig statement.  Court statement regarding exhibit - court finds that probable cause exists and bind over - bail contined  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Michlig statement to court states is not ready to proceed and states reasons and asks for adjournment.  Atty Finlan - moves to dismiss.  Court denies motion to dismiss and sets over.  Bond continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

02:38 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Patrick H Finlan.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Finlan/Michlig statement to motion.  Court Strikes Exhibit and will set for another preliminary hearing.  Finlan moves to dismiss.  Michlig statement to motion to dismiss.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on July 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

03:28 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Patrick H Finlan.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Finlan in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters a not guilty plea.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defense Brief in Support of Motion for Reconsideration to Strike Exhibit 1 and Dismiss
Defense - for Reconsideration to Strike Exhibit 1 and Dismiss

03:07 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Patrick H Finlan.  Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig states witness unavailable to appear - State submits Exhibit 1 (Police Report) for purposes of finding probable cause.  Finlan objects.  Michlig statement to Finlan's objections.  Court statement to Finlan's objections.  Court receives/admits Exhibit 1.  Court finds probable cause does exist and bind defendant over for trial.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Court lifts the no contact provision with Thomas E. Franz - may not discuss case.

02:42 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court with attorney Patrick H Finlan.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant
no contact w/Scott Dumpprope, Thomas Franz and/or Gerry Fredrick Jr.

01:45 pm - Defendant Carrie A. Steinmetz in court, via video, in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel/contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
